content.prompt:
Listen to the excerpt.

The score shown correctly notates the outer voices of a chord progression in four voices. Which of the following statements best describes the voice-leading error that is heard in the performance?

choices.label: The leading tone in the bass in measure 2 does not resolve up to the tonic.
The leading tone in the soprano in measure 2 does not resolve up to the tonic.
The chordal seventh of the predominant seventh chord in measure 3 resolves up instead of down.
The chordal seventh of the predominant seventh chord in measure 3 resolves down by leap instead of by step.

unit.text: 5: Harmony and Voice Leading II - Chord Progressions and Predominant Function

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Apply knowledge of musical symbols and terms to detect discrepancies in pitch and rhythm when comparing notated and performed music in one or two voices.
